newsitem.title: USA: G7 will act properly in forex markets -- Japan.
newsitem.headline: G7 will act properly in forex markets -- Japan.

text.p: Japanese Finance Minister Hiroshi Mitsuzuka said on Monday that the Group of Seven industrial nations are determined to act properly in foreign exchange markets.
"The G7 statement shows on currency shows their firm determination to cooperate in acting properly in foreign exchange markets," Mitsuzuka said at a news conference. He did not elaborate.
The G7 members share a concern about excessive currency movements, he said.
"It takes time for currency markets to understand the intention of the G7 on currency moves," he said.
Bank of Jpaan Governor Yasuo Matsushita told reporters that the BOJ will maintain its current monetary policy of putting emphasis on ensuring economic recovery for the time being.
